title: How to Log Out of Twitter on iPhone, Android, and on Your Computer

steps.title: Go to your profile page.
steps.content: Go to your profile page. From any screen in your browser, click your profile picture in the upper right.

steps.title: Choose "Sign out" in the dropdown menu.
steps.content: Choose "Sign out" in the dropdown menu. When successful, you'll be taken back to the home page.

steps.title: Go to the Account page.
steps.content: Go to the Account page. Tap on your profile picture or go to mobile.twitter.com/account .

steps.title: Click on your profile picture in the top lefthand corner of the app.
steps.content: Click on your profile picture in the top lefthand corner of the app.

steps.title: Confirm by tapping "Log out."
steps.content: Confirm by tapping "Log out." This will only remove the account from your app, not actually delete your X account, and effectively log you out of X. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click either the menu icon (☰) or your profile icon, in the top menu of the app.
steps.content: Click either the menu icon (☰) or your profile icon, in the top menu of the app. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Hit "OK" to confirm that you want to log out.
steps.content: Hit "OK" to confirm that you want to log out.

steps.title: Hit the cog icon in the navigation bar on the left side of the screen.
steps.content: Hit the cog icon in the navigation bar on the left side of the screen.

steps.title: Confirm that you want to sign out by hitting "Log out".
steps.content: Confirm that you want to sign out by hitting "Log out". This will log you out of the main account you're using for X Pro. If you want to remove another account from your list, instead, go to "Accounts" in the navigation bar (the icon looks like two people). Click the down arrow on the account you want to leave, and then hit "Leave this team," followed by "Leave." [3] X Research source
